DOC.brief_summary: Urinary incontinence major health issue woman affect 30-40 % old woman . Surgical treatment SUI undergone many modification last century . The Needleless Sling System one incision , minimally invasive , surgical procedure great acceptance Europe recently receive FDA Clearance use United States . We evaluate effectiveness patient report outcome Needleless® sling system ( Neomedic International ) . This prospective , multicenter , registry . Up 150 woman enrol 3 registry site . Patients evaluated baseline , peri-operatively , post-operatively 2 month , 6 month 12 month . Effectiveness evaluation include stand stress test ( objective cure ) , SANDVIK question ( subjective cure ) & I-QOL ( quality life measure ) . Other evaluation include type anesthesia , concurrent surgery , operative time , post-operative pain , length hospital stay , return usual activity , change lower urinary tract symptom ( BFLUTSSF , void diary ) , goal achievement patient satisfaction .
DOC.criteria: A patient must satisfy follow criterion enter study : 1 . Patient objective demonstrable sign stress urinary incontinence ( SUI ) , include patient ISD . Objective test include : standing stress test , urodynamics evaluation , pad test . 2 . Patient age 18 old . 3 . Patient hysterectomy , tubal ligation otherwise incapable pregnancy , negative pregnancy test prior study entry decide cease childbearing . 4 . Patient agree participate study , include completion studyrelated procedure evaluation , document agreement sign IRB/ECapproved informed consent . A patient meet follow criterion exclude participate study : 1 . Patient associate suspected neurological disease . 2 . Patient anticoagulation therapy . 3 . Patient receive investigational drug device past 60 day . 4 . Patient active lesion present injury perineum urethra . 5 . Patient urethral obstruction . 6 . Patient significant cystocele > ICS Stage 2 . 7 . The subject active infection upon urine dipstick analysis , define ≥ +1 leukocytes ≥ +1 nitrate ( Must reschedule appointment UTI resolve . ) 8 . Patients combined POP surgery .
